Uses of Class
javaslang.concurrent.Future

  • Packages that use Future 
    Package Description
    javaslang.concurrent  

    • Uses of Future in javaslang.concurrent

      Methods in javaslang.concurrent that return Future 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Future<T> Future.andThen(Consumer<? super Try<T>> func)
      Applies the side-effecting function to the result of this future, and returns a new future with the result of this future.
      Future<T> Future.andThen(Consumer<? super Try<T>> func, Executor ex)
      Applies the side-effecting function to the result of this future, and returns a new future with the result of this future.
      Future<T> Future.await(long timeOut, TimeUnit unit)
      Block and wait for this Future to finish.
      static <T> Future<T> Future.completed(Try<T> tri) 
      Future<Throwable> Future.failed()
      Returns a failed projection of this future.
      Future<Throwable> Future.failed(Executor ex)
      Returns a failed projection of this future.
      static <T> Future<T> Future.failed(Throwable t)
      Create a new Future that is already finished with the given exception.
      Future<T> Future.fallbackTo(Future<T> that)
      Returns a new Future which will take the result of #that if and only if this Future fails.
      Future<T> Future.filter(Predicate<? super T> func)
      Creates a new Future by applying a predicate to the successful result of this Future.
      Future<T> Future.filter(Predicate<? super T> func, Executor ex)
      Creates a new Future by applying a predicate to the successful result of this Future.
      <R> Future<R> Future.flatMap(Function<? super T,Future<R>> func)
      Creates a new Future by applying a function to the successful result of this Future and returning the value of that Future.
      <R> Future<R> Future.flatMap(Function<? super T,Future<R>> func, Executor ex)
      Creates a new Future by applying a function to the successful result of this Future and returning the value of that Future.
      <R> Future<R> Future.flatMapTry(Function<Try<T>,Future<Try<R>>> func)
      Creates a new Future by applying a function to the result of this Future.
      <R> Future<R> Future.flatMapTry(Function<Try<T>,Future<Try<R>>> func, Executor ex)
      Creates a new Future by applying a function to the result of this Future.
      Future<T> Promise.future() 
      <R> Future<R> Future.map(Function<? super T,? extends R> func)
      Creates a new Future by applying a function to the successful result of this Future.

      Creates a new Future by applying a function to the successful result of this Future.

      Creates a new Future by applying a function to the result of this Future.
      <R> Future<R> Future.mapTry(Function<Try<T>,Try<R>> func, Executor ex)
      Creates a new Future by applying a function to the result of this Future.
      static <T> Future<T> Future.of(CompletableFuture<? extends T> source)
      A static form of Future(CompletableFuture) and is identical.
      static <T> Future<T> Future.of(Future<? extends T> source)
      Create a new Future based on a Future.
      static <T> Future<T> Future.of(Try.CheckedSupplier<T> source)
      Create a new Future who's value will be calculated asynchronously from the given Supplier
      static <T> Future<T> Future.of(Try.CheckedSupplier<T> source, Executor ex)
      Create a new Future who's value will be calculated asynchronously from the given Supplier
      Future<T> Future.recover(Function<Throwable,? extends T> func)
      Creates a new future that will handle any matching throwable that this future might contain.

      Creates a new future that will handle any matching throwable that this future might contain.

      void Promise.completeWith(Future<T> source)
